form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Murphy introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

form.official-title: To prohibit the administration of any political loyalty test as a condition of Federal employment, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stop Sycophants in Government Act of 2025.

subparagraph.text: has the meaning given the term in section 2105 of title 5, United States Code; and

clause.text: any individual serving in a position for which appointment is made by the President, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate, including an individual serving as the head of an Executive department;
an employee of the United States Postal Service; and
an employee of the Postal Regulatory Commission.

paragraph.text: The term Executive department has the meaning given the term in section 101 of title 5, United States Code.

subsection.text: No Federal official, including the President, may administer a political loyalty test to any employee or with respect to any position as an employee, including—

paragraph.text: as a condition of employment as an employee; or

subparagraph.text: the application process for a position as an employee;
the process of appointing an employee;
the decision whether to promote an employee; or
any contract renewal process with respect to an employee.
